summary: William Holder is identified as having a role within the Black Panther Party (BPP). According to information provided by Melvin McNair, a Delta Airlines hijacker in Algiers, Holder was involved in the BPP. The documents also mention the travels and locations of BPP members, suggesting Holder may have been part of this network. The documents do not provide specific details about Holder's activities or timeline within the BPP, but his association is noted in the context of information gathering on American Black militants/hijackers operating out of Algeria.
significance: The documents do not directly link William Holder to the JFK assassination. His significance lies in his association with the Black Panther Party and his potential involvement in militant activities, as reported in intelligence gathering efforts related to American Black militants/hijackers operating out of Algeria.
